In German, there are two words that are often confused together: "ich" and "mein". While they may look similar, they have different meanings and uses. Here's a quick guide to help you distinguish between them:

"Ich" (pronounced "ick") means "I":

* Ich bin ich selbst (I am myself)
* Ich mag Kaffee (I like coffee)
* Ich werde kommen (I will come)

"Mein", on the other hand, means "my":

* Mein Name ist Anna (My name is Anna)
* Meine Hose ist zu lang (My pants are too long)
* Meine Mutter ist sehr glücklich (My mother is very happy)
